_header: Saint Vincent in Spain to a Christian bishop came
Subjects: saints’ lives; Vincent, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Vincent in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEynt Vyncent in spayne was & to acristene biscop comþat
                    men clupede valleri & nom of him cristendom…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou Ihesu uor þe loue of him lete ous such lif
                    ledeþat we mote to heuene come & for ȝeue ous oure
                    mysdede

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint vincsent in spayne was & to a cristin bysschop
                    comÞat men cleped valerye & nom of hym
                    cristindom…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…now Ihesu for þe loue of hym lete vs soche lyf
                    ledeþat we mote to heuene come & for ȝeue vs oure
                    mysdede

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint vincent in spayne was and to a Cristene Bisschop comþat
                    me clepede valerian and feng of him Cristendom…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe loue of him let vs such lyf
                    ledeÞat we mote to heuene come and for ȝif vs ure misdede
                    A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint vincent In spayne to a cristine bischop camÞat men
                    cleopeden valentin and cristindom of him nam…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…Þen musten neuere martyr non þat hadde more
                    tormentNe þat with som pine ouer come nas bote þe gode man seint
                    vincent
BodLauMis108.Attributed Title: vita sancti vincentii martiris (right margin, f. 91)
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 184-9.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
…Sore agreued & a shamed Hon [sic] ward þei gonne
                    wendeþe kyng þei tolden al þe cas fro bigynnyng to þe
                    ende…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe loue of him let vs suche lyf
                    ledeþat we mowe to heuene come Whan þat we beoþ
                    dede
BodLauMis463.Note:
Last 18 lines only due to loss of folio(s); written in half lines
                    because in two columns.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint uincent in spayne was & to a bischop camþat men
                    clepid ualery & tok of hym crystindom…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu for þe loue of him lete us sich liif
                    ledeþat we mote to heuen come & for ȝeue us oure mys
                    dede

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint vincent in spayne was & to a cristene bissop
                    comþat me clupede vallery & nom of him
                    cristendom…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu for loue of him let vs such lif ledeþat we
                    mote to heuene come & for ȝyue vs oure misdede
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves.
OxfCCC431.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.25-31.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Vincent was borne in spayne & to a bischope he
                    comeÞat me[n] calde valeriane & of hym toke
                    cristendomeVincent dwelled with þis bischope in office als it
                    were& his priue deken he was cristen men to lere…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Now ihesu criste for þe lufe of hym lene vs slike lyfe to
                    ledeÞat we may comme til heuene blis & forgyf vs our
                    mysdede

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint vincent in spaine was & a cristen bissop be bi
                    comÞat me clupede valleri & nom of him
                    cristendom…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou Ihesu for þe loue of him lete us such lyf
                    ledeþat we mote to heuene come & forȝiue us oure
                    misdede

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Vincent in Spayne was ybore and to a cristene bisschop
                    comÞat me clepede Valori and tok of him cristendom…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu ffor þe loue of him lete vs suche lif
                    ledeÞat we mote to heuene come & fforȝiuenesse habbe of oure
                    mysdede

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint vincent was of spayne & to a cristen byschop comeþat
                    me clyped valerie & nome of hym cristendome…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe loue of hym ous lete suche lyf
                    ledeþat we mot to heuene com & for ȝiue oure
                    mysdede

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEint vincent in spaine was & to a cristen biscop comþat me clepeþe valeri & nom of him cristendom…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …now ich for þe loue of him late vs suich lif leþeþat we mote to heuen come & for ȝif ous oure misdede
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum viii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 11v).

BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou Ihesu vor þe loue of him let ous such lif ledeÞat we mote to heuene come & vorȝeue oure misdede

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Vincent was in spayne & to a cristen bisshop he
                    comeÞat men called Valerian & toke þere
                    cristendome…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Now god vs bringe to þat ioye þat he is now to
                    wentAnd graunte vs all part of blisse þat he ȝaf to saynt Vincent
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Vincent in Spayne was & to a cristen bisshop comThat men
                    cleped Valerie and of hym toke cristendom…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for þe loue of hym leue vs such lif to
                    ledeÞat we mowe to heuene come & forȝeue our mysdede
                    Amen
